text: a very sexy orange hazy pour with a tiptop offwhite head and sexy lacing .  mouthfeel : i only had a couple mouthfuls ( did n't even make it through one bottle ) , but it felt more substantial and less watery than o'douls or warsteiner .
appearence : pours a heavy , dark almost-black brown with a giant , frothy beige head .  m : was ok , but nothing to write home about .
the smell was delicious . so many different scents to pick out . this beer smells like christmas .  it had a light feel on the palate with very high carbonation .

it poured a light orange with lots of cloudiness and sediment . there was a thick and frothy 1 finger head which lingered and finally dissolved leaving a fine lacing .  mouthfeel - kind of effervescent .

eye : black in color with ruby highlights , this brew is everything that a doppelbock should look like . the head has good retention , is tan in color and appears to be creamy .  perfect creaminess with a decent bite . mouthfeel - the only thing left is a slight bitterness on the sides of your tongue , average here . drinkability - above average , creamy and satisfying , could have a few of these without an issue .

5.0 s : the nose on this is incredibly powerful , but also incredibly pleasant . a blind man with a cold would be able to figure out there was a beer in the room based on the force that this puts out . there is a bit of sugary sweetness in the taste as well , but nowhere near as strong as the nose ( which is a good thing ) .  the mouthfeel is a bit overcarbonated and burns the tongue a bit .
smell- glorious cherry cordial nose , slight hint of chocolate chips .  light mouth feel . hops win out . ; )

the atwater vanilla java porter is big on aroma , but short on body . this porter is very light . the aroma is filled with vanilla and coffee . still worth a try however .  a big surprise with this one smells great a west coast from the east coast t more big hop flavors but not quite as strong in the mouth but still quite good m a little flat and not as thick as i would like but it leaves some grit on your gums and the flavors hang out for a while d i really liked this beer i nearly took down the jug on my own in no time very unexpected winner with this one , after seeing it 's 7.1 % alc i give it even more props because the whole time i thought i was drinking a low booze ipa .

poured a clear amber , really a reddish gold . was well carbonated , giving a dense one finger head with plenty of bubbling well into the beer .  mouthfeel : a little on the thin side with high carbonation and a slightly dry finish .
s : stunning . hops .  mouthfeel : it seems like a light body beer but the dry pokes and hop prods keep it active until the nearly numbing dry of the aftertaste begs for more .
s : soft fruit , earthy hops , and a bready malty backbone make this one of the most balanced noses i 've come across . pretty good . its like a subtle version of sweetwater ipa .  a little thin .

a - pours a pale , clear yellow , with a huge , billowing three fingers of rocky head . plenty of lacing and excellent retention .  tastes smooth and creamy sweet malt with light fruit flavor hints of spice and light alcohol finish good easy drinking beer little on light side but it does enhance drinkability .

pretty shitty pour on my behalf , with nearly two fingers of off-white , light tan head . slightly hazy burnt orange in color , very pretty to look at . head retention is stellar .  feels quite frothy and wild , perhaps a little over done . the carbonation also seems to mess with the flavor in a distracting sort of way . i get the impression that i 'm missing some of the flavor due to the wild carbonation . the big downfall for me was the carbonation .

as soon i popped open the cap on the bomber , i could smell the aroma , and this came right out of the fridge . some sweet caramel malt shows up as the beer warms up further , but the hop aroma also improves nicely . taking a sip , some tropical fruit and citrus bitterness upfront , then a wash of caramel and bread malt finishes off the tongue . after such a nice aroma , i was slightly disappointed the flavor of the hops did n't play a bigger part in the taste , but still a good dipa . light to medium body with some nice gently prickly carbonation and lightly slick on the tongue .  m : light to moderate body with very little carbonation ( like a cask ) .
frothy head ! that 's pretty much the highlight of this one .  m : light body .

pours a crystal clear deep caramel color with red highlights and has a two finger head that lasts forever .  mouthfeel is a dissapopintment . with this much head , had little carbonation to feel and was also a bit watered down for my taste .

a - black with an enormous head that takes an eternity t fade and leaves thick webs of lacing everywhere on the glass . a mountain of head rests in the middle over still half an inch of head . very pretty .  mouthfeel is a little more thin than i would prefer .

the aroma is excellent , it smells like brown sugar , raisins , figs , cherries , belgian yeast , rum , ginger and some pepper . there 's also a bit of a bitter finish , which i did n't expect since the aroma was so sweet and malty .  medium carbonation and body . nose is the normal malty/hoppy-ness of a porter , starts malty and hoppy and finishes with a nice mostly malty bite . very fresh - brewed 12/13/03 . the abv is 4.5 % .

from notes 9/8/08 : einhorn beer company hefe vigorous pour into my hefe glass yields 2 fingers worth bananas , bananas , bananas good carbonation great nose mouth feel is a little thin , finish is thin left minimal lacing and zero head retention overall i would say , well balanced and a good example of the style . i still think it 's a good example of the style and a refreshing hefe .  holy crap , i think this is the first `` 1 '' i have ever given on taste for a brew . the only thing i can taste is friggin licorice and i hate licorice . this is a bad , bad brew , enough said .

s - grape and cherry permeate the aroma , possibly including some blueberry or tart apple . t - being a lover of wine , too , i immediately taste the tannic presence of the zinfandel . the cherry and tobacco notes from the zinfandel are appealing , however , and keep this from being a horrible score .  if you like pecan you will like this . s- a little too light weight for me .
this beer poured a beautiful , crystal clear cherry brown with little clumps of off white head the left behind a few spots of lace .  mouthfeel - average .
very minty aroma , with really nice accompanyments of herbs , earth , yeast , lemon , and hay - wow , what an unexpected combo ... .  mouthfeel was rather thin for a porter .

appearance : pours a clear amber body with a dense , lush off-white head .  however , you have few choices , this is most likely your cheapest option and most widely drank option . it wasnt terrible , but it just had no real good flavor . if i had a choice between coors light and this , i would have to choose the cheaper of the two , as they are about the same .
whoa ! crazy huge impossible head . looks good once you get it into the glass .  m : light to medium body with fairly high , rough carbonation . lively enough , but a bit unrefined .
amazing aroma ! like nothing i 've ever smelled in a beer .  mouthfeel : medium body with tingly carbonation and an extremely dry finish .

pours a dark as night black from my `` bomber '' bottle . looks great .  smell the smoke , not overpowering and nice . this is a mild tasting smoke beer . recommended for those who find other overwhelming . this is something i could drink alot without geting tired of the smoky taste . seems like the lager styles are milder .

this beer pours a deep , deep amber color that glistens a rich and gorgeous mahogany when held to light . not as dark as i expected , i was pleasantly surprised with the look of this beer and spent nearly a minute admiring it before having a smell .  the mouthfeel is somewhat lacking , however . the lighter mouthfeel only makes this brew easier to drink .
nitro tap into pint glass a : tar black . the softest , tightest head i 've ever seen . beautiful .  it was listed as an imperial stout , but had a relatively light body for such a labeling .

750ml bottle opens with a pop , the deep black liquid pours into a chalice and generates a big amount of cascading foam . it 's surface is actually convex at first , and transitions in color as the liquid trickles through it . the cappucino tan head fades into a charred mahoghany tone closer to the liquid line . fantastic .  mouthfeel was a little lacking considering the initial sweetness .

a- this beer is a yeast hazed golden color with a moderate amount of carbonation rising to the top . the head is nice and white , and has a cloud like texture that is dense . the lacing is also excellent , with dense bubbly goodness clinging to the glass like nothing .  i found it very highly carbonatedalmost too carbonated ( prickly , carbonic qualities are a bit distracting ) .

appearance : pours a hazy orange caramel color with a huge 4 finger thick and creamy off-white head . a touch of sediment pools right on top of the billowy head . the head was so big it rose a full 2 fingers above the rim of the goblet . perfect head retention .  m : just a tiny bit heavier than what i would consider light bodied . wish it had a bit more carbonation , it just feels watery .

very dark appearance with a beautiful tan head . smelled like hazelnut , vanilla , and butterscotch candy . it was very tasty and could see this beer paired well with a desert like tiramisu or cheesecake .  first sip , light bodied brew with almost no carbonation , little watery texture but very crisp , and refreshing on this humid summer eve .

appearance & gt ; black like coffee . great lacing . the ipa is so dark , you 'd never recognize it ... in fact , deschutes calls it a new style `` cda '' -- - cascadian dark ale .  mouthfeel is highly carbonated , i feel a little less carbonation may showcase this beer a little better but overall this beer rocks , i 'm glad i got to try it !

nitro widget results in an absurdly creamy white head that looks and tastes like whipped cream . phenomenal lacing .  m- fairly light and refeshing feel . pretty smooth , but a little over carbonated for the style though .
smells like a beer should in a real classic beer smell that makes beer heritage proud .  feel is a little thin , flat and viscous .

definitively one of the better smelling ipas i 've had in awhile . overall : 4 great smelling beer , but the taste profile is more average to me .  m : a bit thin and watery ; smooth , but i prefer my hefes with a little more body .

s : pure cherry aroma , sweet , pie crust like malt ; this smells like a fresh baked cherry pie ! m : light-bodied , lightly carbonated , watery/lightly silky up front with a crisp , tart finish , wait for it ... like a cherry .  this beer is just flat out terrible . it smells like a loaf of bread soaking in a very bad pitcher of beer . flavor is sour with a hint of bitterness but just plain bad..the only thing i can say for davidson brothers at this point was this beer was not bottled by you it was bottled by shipyard brewing and hopefully they trashed it not you . i do not reccomend this beer to anyone , besides people who like budweiser because it might be slightly better than that .

the aroma is nothing short of phenomenal . the aroma is citrusy and spicey with a lot of fruits and a touch of barnyard funk that i have come to love in good saisons .  mouthfeel is a tad disappointing , not quite as slick , oily , or full as i would have preferred .

color is a rick dark red-brown with no cloudiness .  let me start this by saying that i love all of gl 's beers and appreciatte their quality and price . taste was more of the same with a surprising cooked spinach taste also . aftertaste was also quite disturbingleaving a lingering vegetable taste . i bought a sixer of this beer but could only stomach four of them . i do n't know if the beer intended to taste like this , but even gl makes a mistake every once in a while .
a : looks pretty impressive .  the same followed through to the taste , some malt , but again ruined by the corn . it is smooth , and with the light body it probably would n't be bad in the summer .
unbelievable retention , and perfect lacing .  m : light body , slight effervescence ... not much here .

the beer as it sets in my chalice a pitch-black with the head modest in size and the texture semi-creamy and the color a nice light chocolate color as it ever so slowly dissipates , the lace forms a concealing veil to hide the glass from view .  the mouthfeel is a bit thin , but the flavor makes up for it .

great lakes blackout stout ( 2006 release ) poured deep black topped by a thick mocha head and outstanding lacing .  claims to be be a no carb beer , better described as a no taste beer . almost clear in appearence . it was refreshing i give it that , and if it was really , really hot , it would be a plesant drinking experience , but if you actually want your beer to taste like beer , i 'd give it a miss . it seemed to have gone after the gimmick ( nop carbs ) rather than trying to produce a flavoursome beer . it 's a shame as i hear the rest of the burleigh range is okay .

s : surprised with the nose on this one . plenty of flaral hops . sweet malts in the foundation and a nice citrus zest to freshen it up . t : biscuity malts that were n't very sweet up front left it a little flat ( maybe just a let-down from the smell ) .  mouthfeel - medium body mouthfeel . a tad bit watery .

this one pours a clear copper with a huge nitro head that slowly settles into a finger 's of dense , creamy head .  this beer was an amber color with a thick white head that dissipated quickly . a nice fruity/spicy taste , with some warmth in the aftertaste . it was a little too fizzy for me , but still a very smooth and drinkable beer

a : pours a most pale straw hue , just slightly hazy ; fast growing , huge and tightly silky white froth ( exactly like a perfectly aerated capuccino head ) sustains brilliantly , supported by a lively carbonated body underneath .  m : medium bodied .
absolutely gorgeous .  mouthfeel : medium body , light carbonation .

2011 vintage a- pours a bright orange with a massive fluffy head , very tight bubbles , thick and sticky lacing all over the glass .  m : oily texture with average carbonation and a bitter finish . the mouthfeel is the weakest aspect of the beer .
a- pours a sunset orangey red hue with a nice , 2 finger frothy head which leaves a ton of lacing on the way down .  mouthfeel is okay , but not great .

s- instantly my nose is greeted with the odor of resiny pine and strong grapefruit . very hoppy to say the least . some bread in here too .  a : clean , dark brown/amber , no sediment s : malty , dark fruit , and caramel , t : well balanced bitterness , malty , thick syrupy , dark fruit and caramel , m : thick , smooth , lack of carbonation is the big detracting factor , d : as noted , we had two to make sure - the alcohol is subdued and we quickly finished both bottles ; it 's really that good .

a ) looks great ... deep dark black with a thick cocoa head .  quite honest and good mnchner beer . better than most of the german lagers , like warsteiner , lwenbru and bitburger . excellent taste , nice smell , very good appearance and drinkability . good balance among malt , yeast and hops . it worth a try , for sure .

poured a deep cloudy yellow , with a tall creamy head that dropped down to 1/8 ' lasting head with some lacing . man that 's a good looking beer .  lots of bitter orange , banana , even cinnamon in the taste , with smooth but underwhelming mouthfeel .

pours slightly cloudy golden orange color with 2 fingers of a dense off white head with incredible retention that reduces to a thick cap that lasts forever .  body is medium full , but the carbonation is quite low .
s : funky barnyard aromas up front , but it is not overwhelming . lots of subtle complexities in the nose . i love the nose , but the flavor is really bland .  mouthfeel is average .

amazing fruit nose . taste : surprisingly simple after such a complex nose . initially , some ever-so-slightly bready malts and some black pepper and pine resin . eminently quaffable .  m- medium body , goes down smooth . i was n't too impressed with the mouthfeel .

a- pours a hazy straw yellow with the whitest head of foam out there . literally , one of the most impressive looks for a dipa that is around s- lots going on here .  mouthfeel lacked continuity . good weight for a bpa though and a nice interpretation of the style .

deep-ass black , the darkest head ive seen yet , this just after drinking black tuesday and the abyss . pillowy too .  mouthfeel was a bit of a letdown . it seems the cask had been open for a little while , as the natural carbonation was quite weaker than other cask beers i 've had .

s - intriguing smell , quite unusual . honey , bread , licorice , bubblegum ( heaps ) , sweet liqueur , strawberry and various flower aromas . crazy ! o - just a wacky beer all over . aroma is simply amazing . overall though probably a little bit hardcore given the exceptionally high levels of carbonation and peculiar combination of tastes .  it 's light on the palate and slightly dry . i 'm not a huge fan of wheat beers but this one is really not to my liking .

bottle provided by chris , poured into a perfect pint glass ... a huge whoosh upon popping the cap . a light black with a huge dark tan head , great retention and lacing ... the aroma is sweet chocolate , oak , lactic acid , not a good balance , seems infected to me .  begins sweet , the top is skimpy in its mouth feel , with the finish delightful in its hop spicy bite and the carbonation perfectly matched , also the somewhat bitter and dry aftertaste makes it quite refreshing , quite the quaffable brew , and a new favorite .

s : intense aroma of freshly mowed grass with summer flowers and dandelions . t : over the top hops .  the only real knock on this beer is that the mouthfeel was a bit thin for an imperial stout , if it was more viscous it would be an a+ beer to me .

'' a - 3 finger merengue head sits on top a cloudy golden body and has excellent retention and beautiful belgian lace .  the mouthfeel , however , was watery for a porter , the body medium and the carbonation light . highly quaffable .

it had a very nice hoppy aroma that i could n't wait to try .  smelled of floral hops with a heavy alcohol presence . yeast and hops i guess ? hugely intense ( like a kick in the teeth ) flavor of hops and alcohol . sometimes the hop flavor won out , but mostly just alcohol . bummer . overall i was super dissapointed by the floaties and the overpowering alcohol presence .

this is one of the prettier light beers i have seen . mostly due to the huge thickness and creaminess of the head . the beer itself is crystal clear straw yellow with lots of carbonation bubbles .  but i do n't like ipa . there is flavor , but those damn hops just interfere too much . average feel , but i could n't even finish the sample .

a- poured with a 2 1/2 finger white cloud of foam into a tulip glass . beautiful orange blossom honey hue . minimal lacing , but head sticks around for a while .  m - pretty straightforward . average .

looked fantastic after the pour : a golden yellow-orange color with a big , white , fluffy head that bubbled down very slowly to a lace across the whole top of the beer .  on tap at the brewpub . creamy rich aroma of sweet sugary hops , full of lime juice , fresh grated ruby red grapefruit and a waft of fresh mountain pine . fantastic aroma . flavor is a pandoras box of fresh oranges , mandarins and tangerines , reduced and drizzled over a grainy bite of malt . a bit of that hop buttery note on the finish , with a long creamy smack of grass and cilantro . a touch of chewiness . long aftertaste of apples and bitter resin . a top ipa !

this beer looks great poured out of the bottle with a big billowy head and cloudy golden color .  herbal aromas with toasted grains , similar to a barleywine 's fermented sweetness . the taste is very sour , which builds in layers with each sip . outside of the sour , there is not much flavor except for a slight hint of malt . it is presented as a spring seasonal and it just does n't work , no matter what time of year .

an unusually nice looking beer .  m : very light and delicate mouthfeel . lighter body than i prefer , but it does not bother me whatsoever , all things considered . very slick , almost oily mouthfeel .

am going to sparks tomorrow , looking forward to another pint or two . it looks dark but has a light almost watery mouth feel .  loaded with fresh hops flavor , spicey , that good bitter smack finish . i used to prefer darker beers to american pale ales , but this beer is the one that changed my mind . this beer goes great with crawfish and pizza .
this smells amazing . vinegar coupled with cherries and other ripe to over-ripe fruits . d : this is a great flanders red .  mouthfeel is a little thin and watery .

bbd of oct 06 pours deep honey to amber color with pretty good clarity & a fluffy white head . great lacing & head retention smell : slight leather and fruit notes taste : citric & apricot notes , slight tea-like bitterness with dryness .  light carbonation , exactly what i expected from the appearance , not bad .

the 09 was awesome , the 10 was just good , the 11 was not seen painted ladies pumpkin 09 a 5 deep hazy amber with a beauty of a light beige head .  somewhat dry in the mouth , kind of the weak point of the beer .

a - clear amber , and with a hard pour i got an easy 4 fingers of off white head . retention is decent and a thick cap remains . very nice looking .  s-moderate , almost medium-light body , with a carbonation that at times seemed just a bit too much .

smells good , my kind of ipa .  fruits and booze , non-sweet tastes very sweet at first , but it dies down considerably , which is good . it has a syrupy feel at first , but that fades away too ... more carbonation would have been better .
this beer is absolutely beautiful .  mouthfeel is pretty average i guess , a bit on the thicker side , creamy carbonation .

appearance - the beer pours a dark brown/black colour with a very large frothy and rocky light brown coloured head . i ca n't see much carbonation due the darkness of the beer and there is very nice lacing running down the sides of the glass .  m- this beer felt sightly heavier than it was .

smell wonderful aroma of deep , rich malts . can they be both roasty and toasty ? this dark ale was an awesome nose . taste the taste didnt quite keep pace with the nose . the flavors are nice , but they didnt deliver on the aromatic promise . drinkability a nice attempt at an extremely difficult style .  the body is nothing special however . feels overcarbonated and lacks a nice texture .

s. pungent and tart as heckfire ! funky funk funk , leather , only the finest sweaty gym socks , vinegar , simply out of control ! this is possibly the most pungent , abrasively acidic beer i 've smelled . almost too intense . t. tart .  mouthfeel strikes as kinda light bodied .

the aroma was simply outstanding . it had a sweet hop presence which was citrus in nature ; however , i found it to be sweetly unique in that it resembled a pineapple moreso than orange or grapefruit .  the only fault here is that the mouthfeel is a bit too full for a pilsner . it is thick to the point it seems a bit flat even though there are abundant bubbles . only fault is the weird thickness to this .
the initial aroma of pumpkin and spices is pleasent , but not powerful .  mouthfeel : medium body with hardly any carbonation and a slightly slick finish .

a : pours a hazy golden-straw color with a couple fingers of incredibly dense bright white head that took forever to fade into a dense , thick film that left thick stripes of lacing down the glass .  light , sweet malt aroma ... very little hops . mouthfeel is to style but with an explosion of tiny bubbles .

a-dark orange color ... little head ( which normally i would be against but for ipa 's i actually enjoy ... yes i know the head releases boatloads of fun for most people but for me i do n't like it excessive so this is fine with me ) - s-big huge tropical fruits intermingled with some caramel notes ... .the tropical fruits are fantastic to smell ... i just sat and smelled this beer for about three minutes it was so enjoyable ... mangos , papaya , pineapple , oranges , sweet grapefruit , tangerines and then some peaches and apricots as well ... smells sweet rather than bitter ... .not terribly complex as the pine , tobacco and earthy notes are not evident but no complaints here ... i love a juicy tropical fruit laden dipa and that is what this is.- t-similar to the aroma ... same fruits just not as sweet on the taste ... hops begin to lend a blast of bitterness ... a splash of alcohol evident as well but it mixes nicely and adds some spiciness ... more bitter tasting than the nose led me to believe it would be ... . with 15 hop additions every 15 minutes i expected this to be bold , bitter , and flavorful ... .check ... .check ... check ... .  mouthfeel is thin , but not watery . nice carbonation .

a : pours a perfectly cloudy lemony-yellow with a full , two-finger off-white head .  pleasnt middle ale taste . smooth flavor and easy to drink.no unpleasant aftertaste which i dislike in an ale . generally speaking i prefer fairly strong ales and beers , but this one seems to be of decent quality without excessive hoppiness . recently discovered at a local beer discounter so further review may continue..

first time trying this beer ... i 'm always excited to try american makes of belgian ales , to see who has the real deal skills , but i 'm always leery too , because so few get it anywhere close to right . great funk in the nose . they nailed the nose , that 's the best part of this beer by far . yup , it 's unbalanced . it 's off by a good margin , the malt does n't come through that well and the hops kind of leave you feeling flat and sad .  feels light bodied with tons of carbonation .
poured from the bottle to a golden copper color , with thick off-white head that lingered through whole glass and then reduced to excellent lacing .  carbonated swallow is a tad sharp .
it has a perfect pilsner color .  this really could have been something with a little less carbonation .

rivals the clarity i 've seen from some very highly rated micro 's ! s - wow , dry hopped but very mild aroma - floral and citricy hops , bready malts .  the mouthfeel doesnt impress me . seems a bit thin and maybe chalky from time to time ... maybe from the hoppyness .

a huge blast of sweet citrus assaults the nose , orange rind and lemon . obviously hoppy , and the abv is given away by a trace of alcohol . that gives way on the swallow to a flavor reminding me of cheap gin , and then a half-gin/half-hop aftertaste lingers .  seemed thin in the mouthfeel with almost too much carbonation .

the smell is 90 % hop and 10 % malt . the hop smell is flower and one can almost distinguish the different kinds of hops , but my nose is n't experienced to tell you what they are .  m : light to moderate body and carbonation .
great retention and several sticky lace rings .  feel : the fizz i feel could be less . sips feel light , masked by carbonation .
i think this smells quite good . t - this tastes like a bad cola .  mouthfeel was a bit thin for my liking .

source , serving : draft , 33cl @ trappist smell : lively citrus , honey , yeast and cider , apple soda notes . all blend together with nothing dominating . oddly reminiscent of a zesty italian spritzer . taste : much deeper , darker fruit than you get in the nose . citrus oil and prominent caramel/honey malts come through at first and have an unusual depth which my guess is due to some barely perceptible citrusy hop oilyness and bitterness . definitely different than the refreshing , lively nature of the nose . in the middle its quite hoppy ( mostly grassy ) but has enough cariander/nutmeg and belgian yeastyness to keep it interesting .  and now i know why people say it tastes like chocolate syrup , because it kinda does . but this is really good if you like chocolate . probably 1200 calories in this bottle . but who 's drinking beer and watching calories ?

pours a hazed-copper with an inch of lingering creamy off-white head . lots of carbonation and thick concentric bands of lace .  m - this part is a bit underperforming , but only relative to the rest of its strengths ; it just does n't have the substantive feel that i want , but it has proper carbonation and relative weight .
courtesy of jrancan via gif 2.0 poured an orange-cooper color with a thick tannish head .  m : average carbonation and the hop bitterness sticks around .

appearance : a yellow / amber colored body topped off with a fluffy white head . the retenion was pretty good and the lacing was abundant .  founds this a bit too fizzy for the style , possibly overcarbonated , possibly i do n't know wtf i 'm talking about .

nice very uniformly hazy straw yellow body that is served with a 1/2 finger foamy white head . head has really good retention and lacing is left most of the way down the glass .  m : it feels light to medium bodied with high carbonation . rather smooth though .

pours about half a finger length of head atop a dark brown body with a red tinge when held up to the light . when the head is high , the legs are nice and thick as i tilt . my initial impression was this tastes awfully similar to a turbodog brown ( not sure if it 's the malts they are using ) .  mouthfeel/drinkability : mouthfeel is pretty medium bodied , a bit thin and not overly impressive for an ris .
pours a deep amber color with a really cool creamy head .  m - i would 've preferred a slightly more viscous feel .

from start ( awesome appearance due to the creamy head and lacing ) to finish ( great nutty aftertaste ) this was quite an enjoyable christmas evening treat !  i noticed to yeast in the bottom of the bottle after i read that it was bottle conditioned on the label . the malt comes through as i drink . there is the malt backbone with some hops . i guess i 'm just so used to ipa 's and dipa 's . this is a really drinkable beer .
when we finally opened it , it wafted aromas : stouty roasted malt , bourbon .  mouthfeel is a but flat .
smell is extremely nice with strong notes of ripe fruit , caramel , toffee , and toasted malt . very pleasant mixture .  mouthfeel- a little thin and soapy feeling .

this oktoberfest pours a very deep copper-red into my mug with a moderate white head that quickly diminished to thin skim but with a patchy lasting lace . i must say the color of this brew is truly something to marvel at , incredible dark copper-red with extreme brilliance .  mouthfeel is decent but a little slick .

s - chocolate milkshake , smoked meats , light roastiness .  poured from bottle to sniffer , looks like weak drip brewed coffee , ok head that diminished to a lace that stayed till the beer was gone . smelled of chocolate malts and coffee . the taste was that of black coffee with chocolate syrup added . i like this beer alot this is number five of six so drinkability is up there .

pours a deep dark brown with lighter hues on the edges . a creamy off white head from a hard pour goes from about an inch to a couple centimeter cap after a few minutes . retention is superb and lacing is superb as well .  peach / apricot on the nose with a bit of yeast , very interesting bouquet . a little taste of toffee/candy , again apricots , but not overwhelming . mild bitterness . very drinkable , very refreshing , i could see myself drinking this on a hot summer day ( unlike today ) , but nothing complex about it .
a : i love the look of this beer . nice head and great lacing .  m : i wish this beer had a bigger presence on the palate as the feel is too light and overcarbonated for the style .
lacing was excellent ; the glass was a history of every sip taken .  it was medium in body with moderate carbonation .

the nose is great . it 's been a while since i had a unibroue , but i never tire of their awesome yeast . clean , phenolic , very spicy , a little musty , a little wild , maybe souring milk , very rich with tropical fruit like mango and pineapple .  light mouthfeel , good session brew for this time of year .
12 oz bottle poured into a tulip tumbler . a cloudy dark brownish orange with a massive head .  one of the best winter warmers i 've had .

smells great . yeasty , malty , fruity - especially mango and citrus .  pours a thin , tan head , light brown/red coloring . aroma is a little hoppy but has a nice malt background . big hop flavor , small hints of toffee , but overall a nice maltiness . bitterness is on spot for an esb , as well as the floral marks . i 'd very much buy this again if i can find it .
this filtered masterpiece pours from the growler a golden hue with crazy lace and a beautiful head .  m : nothing to extremely special . a nice round fullness .

poured a dark dark brown with a super creamy light mocha head .  i found this beer to be a touch watery compared to other oatmeal stouts ( specifically b.o.r.i.s . ) , but overall a nice stout that convinced me to try other beers from anderson valley brewery .
smell of dry pine wood and chocolate and a lot of vanilla . the aromatic smell was enticing ! t : i would have expected this to taste a bit smoother than it did .  a medium body and a little thin .
