aroma makes up for what this brew lacks in looks ; wonderful , wonderful aroma of dark cherries , some cinnamon and apple . i considered this a good thing , but if you 're turned off by cherries this will decidedly not be your deal for the taste carries over the cherry aroma . really pretty great stuff , but not your typical drinking experience by any means , and definitely for special occasions .  m : this is where this beer really shined for me .

smell is really good on this beer , unfortunately it is far and away the best part about it . light caramel maltiness with a healthy dose of alcohol . bready yeast aroma as well . i enjoyed this beer , especially the aroma . a whole bomber to myself might be a but much , but i think it is a decent american tripel .  m : very full bodied and it is like i am eating a fresh piece of grapefruit when i take a sip .

the aroma is a true gift . many good smells involved ; clove/orange/spice/even cotton candy . another truly wonderful belgian offering .  mouthfeel was superb . very smooth and thick , and with just enough carbonation .

the pour dropped a nice 2 finger cream head that receeded and left great lace . this is one seriouly good looking beer .  this has a nice , smooth mouthfeel , and the foam leaves a good lacing around the glass .

i like the bell 's two hearted ale and when i spotted a single case of bell 's hopslam in my neighborhood beer distributor , i had to purchase the case served into a shaker pint glass . s : the most amazing aspect of this beer is the smell . i detect a mix of grapefruit , orange and pineapple aromas . t : for a beer whose label declares it to be a `` biting , bitter , tongue bruiser '' , it has a nice sweet malt backbone . notes : this is a pricy beer , but a must try for any hop head .  mouthfeel is full , rich and lush . i almost wonder if they added some maltodextrine to beef up the mouthfeel .

s : outstanding aroma , and not what i expected from a saison . a light yeast funkiness comes through shortly after that , adding balance and complexity . outstanding .  there feel is pure perfection . it coats the mouth and leaves a satin residue in the finish .

aromas of smoked meats , chocolate , peat , and woody . tastes of smoked meats , woodiness , a pile of raked autumn leaves , vanilla , and very light whisky .  wonderfully thick and viscous in mouthfeel , slick with a subtly prickly carbonation teasing the tongue .
startling aromas of grow-room just before harvest seem appropriate to the style . very assertive .  the feel is full , velvety , and soothing .

purchased through west lakeview liquors , chicago price - $ 10.99/6-pack appearance : wow , this beer looks awesome in a glass .  m : the mouthfeel is exceptional . a very nice silky smooth body with light fluffy carbonation .

this has an intriguing , absolutely wonderful aroma to it .  m : fantasticaly smooth - medium bodied , fine bubbles . velvety ! d : gettin ' up there in abv % , but this one 's just really well crafted - better so than the unearthly , in my opinion - and is one of the better dipas i 've had the pleasure of trying .

s : hoppy pine aroma with a fruity afterthought t : very strong initial hops taste that leads into a fruity citrusy feel that overwhelms your palate . hops tastes like christmas barf/potpourri but it smells a lot better than it tastes  this is a little heftier than the supposed style stalwart , hoegaarden , but the soft , almost creamy mouthfeel makes this a surprisingly satisfying beer without being heavy .

wow . otherwise , this beer is incredibly complex , with aromas of chocolate and vanilla , coupled with the cognac brandy smell . the flavors on the palate generally replicate the nose , except the brandy flavor is a bit more subdued .  full bodied , silky smooth and creamy .
the aroma on this is crazy good . malts , coffee and an irish cream aroma , smells even better than it tastes . very good but not great .  m - super creamy , coating the whole mouth . very nice .

i 'm really impressed . the flavor is definitely like a hefeweizen . the flavor is n't quite as strong as the smell , but it 's still really good . it 's cloudy and thick , but it goes down very easily and paired well with some pasta .  m : super smooth with a thick body .
hot damn that smells like pumpkin pie .  m : low carbonation yields a smooth and silk laden mouthfeel .
smell : sweet fruity esters come out with brown sugar and one of the greates smells of all time ... vanilla cake !  very impressed d- good imperial stout , great mouthfeel !

aroma is excellent . behind some lemon and sourness i almost get a west-coast ipa - apricot , grapefruit , orange , tangerine , maybe a bit of pine .  m - full bodied , sticky sweet but not cloying . coats the mouth perfectly , with a touch of dryness in the back end . good carbonation , too .

aroma - definitely it 's best quality - sweet pumpkin pie - sugar - cinnamon - nutmeg - malty taste - sweet and pumpkiny up front - hoppy and dry finish - not a bad combination - very suprising and unique mouthfeel - smooth - carbonation not overbearing drinkability - great pumpkin , but i like this style a tad bit more smooth and sweet at the finish .  the mouthfeel is right on the money !
monk madness smells of fresh doughy bread , also kind of piney and sweet malt aromas .  feels like liquid velvet , as all of the best tripels should , imo .
the aromas were permeating- harsh cirtusy hops , leafy rawness ; great for a refreshing aroma , though the maltiness is lost almost immediately .  the mouthfeel is a pleasurable experience .

aroma - overpowering smoke and meat aroma which is indistinguishable from cooking sausage . awesome i ca n't imagine a better smoked aroma .  flavor is exceptional , very subtle and complex on the palate full body excellent complement to the flavor .

on tap at churchill 's pub & grille in san marcos , ca a- crimson copper with bright garnet hues , two finger off white head , good retent , leaves thin lacing s- sweet , malty , caramel , toffee , pine , citrus , cherry t- sweet toffee up front that yields to some pine hop flavors that produce some bitterness but do n't overcome the malts . m- medium body , carbonation tickles , smooth d- amazing complex flavor and jaw dropping beautiful color .  mouthfeel is full and round .

nice aroma on this ! deep dark chocolate with cocoa , lots of cocoa . smells wonderful ! chocolate , cocoa , coffee , walnuts with a hint of vanilla and a nice hop bite . this tastes great !  m - huge milkshake like feel on this brew makes it feel great in the mouth . this is an excellent full body for a porter with this much chocolatey flavor .

smell : for a pale ale it packs a punch . definately a west coast pale ale as there is a huge citrusy hop aroma . the centennial and cascade hops used are very noticeable . huge grapefruit rind and hop resin in the nose . from the smell alone i would call this an ipa . taste : the flavor does n't quite live up to the aroma . this is a very good american pale ale , but again , the aroma promised more .  m : nice full body with a creamy mouthfeel .

6 oz bottle purchased at monument wine and liquor in concord , ca appearance was a dark brown with lighter highlites toward the bottom smelled great . one of the better smelling beers ever . very cider-y with what smells like a very strong brett nose . tasted good .  m - creamy , velvety , perfect .

s- strong smell of booze but with a sweet note that makes it quite nice . t- nice flavor that 's almost surprisingly sweet but boy does it burn .  m : thick but clean in the mouth , almost oily , with a warming alcohol effect down the throat . light carbonation balances the thickness of this brew quite perfectly . d : hmm , i do n't think this beer gets all the credit it deserves .

a : pours a black opaque with rich reddish brown fizzy head b : smells of licorice and blueberry as soon as i opened the bottle t : lightly bitter , blueberry comes in the aftertaste , definitely not a `` fruity '' beer . m : rich and smooth over the tongue d : good stout  t/m-extremely full bodied and quite syrupy . very smooth on the palate and a low level of carbonation that i actually very much enjoy .

s : abundant volatile citrus peel and tropical fruit fills the room to announce this beer 's hop presence . pale toast and fusile alcohols strain to be detected upon closer examination . t : begins dry with floral , pine , and grapefruit citrus hop flavors .  m : perfect body and balance !

the aroma is easily the highlight of this beer for me and is among the best of any barrel aged stout i 've tried . rich balanced blend of flavors , focusing on the coffee and sweet bourbon/vanilla from the barrel aging . unfortunately i enjoy the aroma much more than the rest of the experience as the flavor is more similar to the cw bourbon barrel stout , as well as the too thin , undercarbonated body . the finish is also particularly short and dry resulting in disappointment . the flavor is much more bourbon and vanilla forward than the aroma and is lacking the richness and balance of the aroma . i 'm enjoying the central waters beers i 've tried so far , but maybe my expectations are too high as i keep waiting for one to `` wow '' me and that has n't happened yet .  mf= medium body with a slightly crisp to crisp mouthfeel . carbonation was near perfect for the style in my opinion .

the aroma is stunning and sublime , conjuring images of freshly baked pumpkin pie , with a huge serving of cream . the crust is warm , sweet and nutty , and the pumpkin is perfectly spiced . if only the real deal smelled this good all the time ! its replaced by a moderately bittersweet spiciness in alcohol kick , which serves as a precursor to the pumpkin filling itself . the aroma is a revelation to me , and it seems to have a lot in common with rogue 's hazelnut nectar .  mouthfeel is very full and chewy .

the first thing you notice about this beer is the smell . it is like sticking your nose in a grapefruit is is so citrusy and tart . what you smell is what you taste , but it gets bolder on your tongue . the hops really let you know they are there by the time this stuff hits you throat . a overall very nice , flavorful ipa .  mouthfeel is amazingly soft over the tongue , and drinkability is superb as well .
the smell is delightful . this is sweet biscuity malts , chocolate , molasses , and caramel .  perfect . 5 an easy drinker .
complex aromas , with tartness full-on and up-front . robust enough to feel like an ale , but only just . undeniably delicious .  mouthfeel is silky smooth .
you can smell the hops from across the room . i think that 's the one thing that sticks out the most is the hop smell of this beer .  the mouthfeel is very full , rich , bold , and creamy .

if you love the smell of hops , this is great stuff . brewdog again did it for me . smell is fantastically green herbs hops and grass , also the apricot ( ?  sits in the mouth well extremely creamy porter that was very enjoyable .
insane lacing & very good head retention s : sweet caramel notes & fruittyness t : caramel sweetness up front , then dryness .  m - creamy and velvety , not syrupy by any means . low carbonation .

as soon as i opened it , i was immediately reminded of my grandmother 's famous and extremely delicious strawberry pie ! the taste is no different than what one would expect from a beverage that smells like a strawberry pie . the natural tart of strawberries popped out with one swig .  the mouthfeel was super bubbly , light and creamy on the palate .

s : this beer is awesome here . smoked bacon . it sounds bad until you try this one .  m : a silky smooth mouthfeel that was also very crisp . an awesome feeling beer that was very easy to drink and very , very smooth . d : excellent mouthfeel and taste combination .
) great aroma upon agitating the beer . nice crisp hoppy smell .  m : medium bodied , slightly carbonated , and incredibly smooth .

this is one of the best looking beers i 've ever seen .  this feels more like a stout to me ... the mouthfeel is amazing . it 's almost like licking a wet board , freshly hewn from the live tree . there 's a graininess reminiscent of chewing on raw sugar cane , and i can feel all of the wonderful fibrous matter in the mouthfeel of this beer .

great aroma and flavour backed with enough malt sweetness to make it palletable . i could n't drink too much of it but hop heads will love it . a slight green tinge in colour from the hops is visible .  i would say that mouthfeel is perfect for the style , chewy and full , and the carbonation is there but very light with a natural feel .
excellent smell , very subtle all around .  m : smooth , medium to light body ; small particles of yeast give an interesting texture d : extremely drinkable , smoothest hefeweizen i 've had .

has a strong bubblegum/clove yeast aroma . sweet malts underneath with a little sugar and something citric even further in the background . the nose really reminds me of aventinus weizenbock , and to me that 's a good thing .  the mouthfeel is the best part of this beer .

seriously smells like a fresh bag . unbelievable . sweet almost port flavor with sweet cherries , raisins and then that beautiful twizler flavor . phenomenal . has some syrup feel to it , but complements flavor appropriately . very impressed with this .  m : nitro + stout = perfection . huge , silky body with a 100 % chance of creaminess .

really nice . t & m : big , aggressive first sip -- carbonation and alcohol-heavy coffee taste .  this mix is just exceptional ! mouth feel is creamy , thick , carbonated , and just wonderful . you can sip on this for hours .

great aroma and really inviting .  m- thick , chewy , sticky . great adjectives for a strong beer . a nice mellow carbonation is present enough to give an even fuller feel . d- very good , if pours of this were n't $ 7 a pop i would have drank this all night .

s : lots and lots of hops ! wonderful smell as well . t : just as i thought , lots of hops and citrus . i loved almost everything about this beer except the tast .  luscious , velvety and silky smooth ... what any exceptional dipa should feel like . all in all , i prefer `` plain '' un-earthly .
smell - there is good amount of malty goodness right away .  mouthfeel is very full and round .
appearance : giant fluffy white head on a clear pale yellow body showing strong carbonation .  exquisite mouthfeel front , middle , and finish .

i had this beer poured from a can into a pint glass ... a : the beer pours a light amber color , with some golden highlights and a small white head with minimal lacing ... s : the smell the best part , nice and hoppy ... t : after the hoppy aroma , i was very unhoppy ( pun intended ) to find a dearth of hoppiness . more sweet and malt than hoppy , and this is a fresh can ( from june 25th ) ... m : a little too chewy for an apa , at least , imo ... d : eh , its not bad , but i prefer snpa over this one .  amazing . this is just the second beer i 've had from alesmith and they both lived up to their reputation .

the beer gave off aromas of different spices like cinnamon , dried basil , and paprika along with the aroma of alcohol and fruits .  mouthfeel is light/medium bodied with the perfect amount of carbonation , love how this one feels .
s- smell is pleasantly hoppy .  it has a richness to it that is accentuated by the velvety mouthfeel .

berry and malt aroma with strong spicy hops . tastes significantly less exciting than the intense and wonderful aroma . low hops upfront that continue into an excellent bitter finish .  the high carbonation makes for a wonderfull mouthfeel for a hefe-weisse .
beautiful mocha or capuccino color head . head has lots of protein chunks , dissipates very slow , and leaves beautiful lacing .  mouthfeel - perfect about of carbonation and body .
s : fantastic aroma . loads of citrus up from with a very clear grapefruit juiciness .  silky creamy as it gives a nice full mouthfeel . i prefer this to the regular .

smells very good ! little to no hop presence . this beer has super flavor , again , very sweet . mini alcohol burn .  nice weight , carbonation , and roundness in the mouth .

hazy yellow body with a musty , funky , grassy , barnyardy aroma . taste starts flat with an salty , effervescent selztery quality , moves into a tart mid-palate followed by a sharp , hop bitterness in the finish . the aroma is this beer 's high point , but i would recommend this beer to a saison drinker on the strength of the aroma alone .  very full bodied , bordering on syrup but with a silky smooth finish .
the hop aroma is amazing to me . i get grapefuit and citrus in the nose .  i have no idea how this absolutely stunning mouthfeel got attached to a mediocre beer like this .

enjoyed at the papago bar . an unusual one.great pear aroma , also sweet honey .  t-alot going on here starts out with the sweetness that the nose hints and finishes with a wonderful bitterness on the back of your tongue that lingers so you know you just drank an ipa , but it is incredibly smooth almost silky good medium to light body with an incredible carbonation level makes it a nice ipa even for someone not used to the style .

smell : complex and delightful ! cloves and apple cider are prominent . just a beautiful boquet ! carbonation is quite mild which works well though the mouthfeel is a little thin.. notes : altogether a delightfully balanced and enjoyable brew , but just not at the top of the heap in terms of complex flavors .  beautiful pour and very thick on the tongue ; its a pretty heavy brew , but still quite drinkable .
it actually has a pretty decent ipa aroma with a nice amount of pine and citrus hops .  mouthfeel is absolutely perfect .

nice nose . all around beautiful and promising . very short finish .  m-this beer has a medium-full mouthfeel with a very creamy texture with a soft faint alcohol warmth in the finish . d- this beer has a smooth flavor that has a very subtle complexity and a nice flavor but the creamy texture and head is just amazing .

decent strength here as well . quite nice . taste : toasted and wheat malt again with nots of caramel and sweet candy sugar as well .  m- big heavy resiny sticky mouthfeel . nice minimal carbonation with a nice creamy mouthfeel .

outstanding retention .  entry is silky smooth with just a touch of carbonation showing on the back of the tongue .

the exotic aromas are powerfully fruity with some alcoholic depth . hints of freshly ground black pepper & crushed cloves add to the overall complexity . the flavor starts off with just a touch of honey sweetness , but evolves into a very hoppy , dry , slightly ( yeasty ) & peppery finish .  mouthfeel was full and creamy with a lot of vanilla up front , followed by a mounds-like coconut/dark chocolate taste on the finish .

smell is absolutely delightful . notes of citrus , spices and yeast are all present in the nose .  m- smooth as a baby 's ass . d- something this smooth goes down real easy . truly fantastic , be sure to try this if you have n't already .

aroma of creme brulee , vanilla , cream , coffee with cream , caramel . not as pleasant as i envisioned on the palate : cola with pours of vanilla , light coffee , caramel , syrup .  it is very creamy , great mouthfeel .
brown with light brown highlights , there 's an off-white head with excellent retention and lacing . truly gorgeous .  for the style and flavor of this beer it has a perfect mouthfeel .

smells amazing when you first pour it . smells like chocolate and coffee , as it warms that smell changes to mainly hops . very hoppy flavor , but not too much .  mouthfeel - very smooth , agreeable carbonation level , slightly heavy , right on for the style .

anyhoo , the brew had a wonderful nose : crisp hops and fruity malt . the fruitiness was very clean , not all messed up with yeast and funky phenols . very inviting . kinda reminded me of white chocolate or vanilla . after that though was a brief dose of grain alcohol ( think cheap vodka ) .  a little light for a german style but still tastes distinctly german . creamy mouthfeel and very , very smooth . medium bodied well carbonated making it quite drinkable .

great aromas of cocoa dominate the nose . i feel like i 'm smelling a hot chocolate or the inside of a powdered packet of hot chocolate mix . great aroma and taste and easy to drink on top of that .  mouthfeel is great . crisp , clean , and dry finish .

smell : oh , sweet mother of god -- this is what the panties of angels must smell like . damn . taste/mouthfeel : strong hop presence right off the bat . the taste is very bold , but oddly , no particular flavor really stands out . it 's not novel or extreme , but it 's really , really good . drinkability : well , i mean , come on , it 's almost 10 % and so thick it gets into your pores ; you can only drink so much of this stuff .  m- perfect . d- nice to hang out and have a couple .

smells inticingly fruity , filled with citrus and light fuity aromas . hopping is definately a big player , adding a nice light piney aroma . malts lie beneath , providing a smooth balance filled with caramel and whipped topping and a nice toasty core . an absolutely , hands down , mouth-watering aroma . tastes mildly sweet and oddly blank . i enjoyed the full hop bitterness and fruity nose , but ca n't help but think that the flavor could have been better .  m - mouthfeel is perfect . silky smooth bubbles and full bodied texture .
the smell is all hazelnuts : sweet and earthy .  the mouthfeel is what surprised me as it felt very rich and smooth .

very nice and complex aroma . with a swirl of my sniffer , there is a blast of toffee aroma ! very nice . the aroma had me expecting a lot more than what i got . m-full thick syrupy almost feel .  smooth body with a near perfect richness and carbonation .
aroma is very nice full of pine and citrus .  mouthfeel is full and round .

excelent ! its a beautiful thing . overall , one good ipa - though the boquet easily outshines all other characteristics .  great mouthfeel . very drinkable .

i get tons of clove and tons of cinnamon and it just smells absolutely fantastically fresh and bold and full of wheaty goodness .  m - full body and medium-light carbonation makes for a smooth texture that fizzes slightly on your tounge . it warms the mouth and feels creamy . very unique feel and one of my favorite things so far .

opaque black/brown with a brown sugar colored head .  very full bodied , viscous , almost chewy and smooth on the palate , with soft carbonation - one of the best mouthfeels i 've ever came across in imperial stout .

poured from the hippie designed bottle w/ 3 pumpkin men appearing to be brewing their `` autumn ale '' into a 16oz jack 's pumpkin spice ale weizen glass . aroma- has the closest aroma you can possibly get to having pure cinnamon and red apples while being in a beer ! unbelievable ! no hops to be found but may be very sweet with malt . sweet and then a bit watered down . overall impression- while jimmy john 's shops across the nation promote `` free smells '' with a neon light outside each one , this brew had an aroma i gladly paid for ! awesome amount of cinnamon and apple in the nose but then the taste hit and it was a tad watered down ... would have liked much more body in this one and it might have been in my top 10 brews of all time !  the body is nice , not thin and not slick , wonderfully smooth and crisp .
while i did think the smell was wonderful i was left wanting in taste .  mouthfeel- thick and rich like a good imperial stout should be . great carbonation and texture .
caramel/smokey fragrance soon after opening . pure stout with a creamy mouth-feel and smooth swallow .  silky smooth in the feel care of the nitro delivery .

the nose on the beer was delectable . a light maltiness sat underneath prevalent esters of banana and spicy cloves .  low carbonation , and an astringent finish , with a hint of warming alcohol . perfect . d- excellent .
aroma is fantastic ! ... sweet , malty , almost rumlike .  mouthfeel- the texture is creamy and sublime , absolutely perfect in every way .

the hop aroma is amazingly resiny . overall , an incredibly good wet hop ipa .  one of the thickest beer i have ever tasted , equal to the thickest , this is milkshake thick . quite an interesting beer but way to thick to drink in quantity .
overall , this is a tasty , aromatic , and very smooth-drinking dubbel . another amazing offer from the rarely-disappointing north cost .  the mouthfeel on this beer is really what sets it apart .

very pleasant aroma makes me anxious for that first sip . d - the dryness in the mouthfeel definitely leaves me wanting more , and the great aroma makes me happy to keep bringing it back .  mouthfeel is perfect . a rich , creamy treat .

even before the glass met my nose i could pick up the smoky aroma . that aroma was strong yet oddly made my mouth anticipate what was to come . one would expect such an assertive taste as smoke to dominate or destroy the other flavors that are present in this beer , but that was not the case at all . the smokiness is most definitely there and in force , but somehow the darker malt flavors still manage to poke their heads above the smoky storm and make their presence known .  m/d : perfectly carbonated , smooth , and incredibly easy to drink . champagne-esque mouthfeel and drinkability .

poured into a plastic water glass as i had nothing else ... the beer pours a ridiculous white head that is tall , thick and beautfiul atop a clean pale gold beer .  feel ( 5/5 ) very effervescent on the tip of the tongue in the initial taste ( almost reminiscent of the more carbonated belgian ales , like duvel in this respect ) . this transitions to a wonderful fullness as it washes to the back of the mouth .

the aroma came off very sweet but did not mask the large alcohol smell . think of sherry , or cognac .  first , the appearance and mouthfeel are perfect by my standards for the style . mouthfeel is perfect ; thick , smooth , creamy and a long lasting citrus rind and biting hop finish .

big roasted coffee and dark chocolate presence in the nose ; very pleasant to the point where i 'd buy it as an air freshener for my car . however the flavor , while not bad by any means , did n't seem as robust as the nose .  mouthfeel : incredibly smooth and crisp . definitely the best part of this beer . drinkability : the clean flavors and really smooth mouthfeel make this incredibly easy to drink .
soapy noble hops . what can i say i love the aroma but i am not too fond of the finish .  mouthfeel is super thick and coating .

sweet chocolate malty aroma with a very nice roasty character and subtle vanilla . very complex aroma , hopefully the flavor lives up to it . hints of oatmeal , toffee , very burnt toast and licorice with a nice dry bitter hop character in the finish . it 's a bit too harsh for me and extremely bitter , taking away from the silky chocolate and vanilla notes that i liked so much . pretty complex but a bit one dimensional for me .  great , great mouthfeel .
the pour is very duvel-like with a large frothy head and lively carbonation rising to the top .  great mouthfeel , nice and crispy , but not before you get to taste the beer .
smells wonderful ! this brew has a caramel and grapefruit nose that is deep and fulfilling .  wonderfully smooth body .

absolutely fantastic . t : exactly as above with some freshly shaved lemon/orange zest .  finishes crisp with slight honeysuckle sweetness & a slight peppery edge mf : light bodied & crisp , perfect balance super drinkability , a near perfect kolsch .

extreme bourbon in the nose along with cherry and vanilla . fantastically balanced so that every nuance can be appreciated . quite good , but neither worth the price ( $ 30/750ml ) nor hype .  and this was a grave mistake , as this beer is truly excellent . i noticed the mouthfeel before the flavor : the bottle conditioning mj pointed out on the label made this beer velvety smooth .

the aroma is super sweet and matly . vanilla dominates this then you get some nice notes of brandy , and wood . the feel is really weak here . overall , this is ok , nothing special , the grand cru crushes this .  fantastic palate , great mouthfeel , smooth silky yet carbonated very well .

a great beer to smell . not an amazing beer to drink .  black cherries take on a sweet and sour lemon , with balsamic edge , which is both mouth-puckering and refreshing . carbonation comes out as creamy in the forefront , with a medium blast in the throat , all at the same moment . then returns to being creamy and rolls down the throat . pleasing .

complex aromas sets this beer apart from others of its style . every time i took a whiff , i could pick up different aromas like oatmeal , raisins , brown sugar , and flowery / earthy hops ( no doubt a result of dryhopping ) . easily drinkable and pairs well with a nutty cigar . the best damn us maibock i 've had yet . this brewery is growing on me .  m : perfection here , this is a great beer for chewing .
pretty nice looking , fits the bottle color scheme and the devil motif pretty well .  the carbonation , while lacking in the glass , is perfect on the palate . the mouthful is fantastic .

one thing about hop bombs , for all their flaws , is they smell amazing . this does n't disappoint . nice .  slightly dry taste toward the end m : perfect mouthfeel as far as i 'm concerned , very smooth and creamy goes down very well .

very fragrant , very complex smell t : caramel , molasses , dark fruit ( fig/raisins ) , m : heavy bodied beer , drinks pretty smooth . d : nice cold weather sipping beer , very tasty .  mouthfeel - 5.0 loved the mouthfeel .

big beer , big aroma . reallly big aroma . gobs and gobs of sweetness here . it 's interesting . not so sweet as to overpower though , as in their doppelbock .  it 's extremely mouth filling and hefty , yet luxuriously smooth , like a silk-covered sandbag . the feel of it alone will keep me coming back . finish is long and roasty .
the smells are great , but the taste i find to be a little normal .  this is an extremely active beer with an incredible mouthfeel .
strong citrus hop aroma , hints of orange that fades .  perfect texture .

t- sweet , caramel , maple syrup , vanilla , and bourbon ! i 've had many bourbon aged beers , but this is over the top but tastes like dirty bastard with a few shots of bourbon . crisps , dry , and sweet ! d- not my style , but could drink one or two on a cold winter night .  mouthfeel is excellent , smooth as butter .

smell was rich and aromatic . initially when poured from the bottle , it was sweet and candy-like with noticeable milk chocolate and fragrant caramel malt aromas .  m : perfect . big bodied , oily , and effervescent .

we shall see ... nose ... sometimes beers just `` smell '' like california ... i 'm not sure if it my early experiences with sierra nevada ( or boontville esb ) that has made such impression on my mental remembrance of the olfactory experience that is west coast goodness ... fresh , deep hops buttressed by caramel/sweet malt , the complete package , this smells spot on , it has that `` red '' sharpness to it was well , sort of giving it a dry-ish feel , the hops can be teased out and pronounce themselves sharply when sought after ... great . taste etc ... medium bodied , the carbonation does n't really sparkle here like i feel it should to give this a better ride , the aftertaste is exactly like the smell , and i am digging that but the initial sips seem to be lacking a bit , this tastes more like an apa or a weak ipa.. not that styles are n't meant for interpretation ... i am just not mclovin ' it .  thick and chewy with minimal carbonation ... exactly as this beer should be .

exceptional nose . bubble gum esters mixed with vanilla and banana topped off with a little pepper . solid effort on this hefe-weizen .  m - medium bodied , creamy goodness . highly satisfying .

this beer has an amazing aroma - possibly one of the nicest smelling beers ( certianly that i have experienced ) . light carbonation ... overall - a exceptional beer - one of my favourites ... highly recommended ...  m - incredibly creamy and smooth , with good carbonation . terrific mouthfeel and very well balanced .

a great aroma ! the taste however is pretty weak .  this is a meaty brew ; full bodied and luscious , one of the best in my opinion . carbonation that was not very visible reveal themselves while sipping ; nice .

the lace sticks pretty well w/ rocky cap that is like a mound of cream s - a smell that is akin to dessert -imagine a cinnnamon and apple scent like the filling of a dunkin donut apple cinnamon donut . the sweetness is apparent w/ dark stone fruit quality and red pear elements w/ mild juiciness in the nose w/ subtle nutmeg and cinnamon stick notes w/ a gentle arom of raisin m - the feel is spicy and light tartness w/ mild sour fruit and mild bitterness w/ high carbonation level and bitter spicy finish w/ a dry slightly astringent quality t - a taste that is both fruity and surprisingly bitter compared to the nose and for the style w/ piney and bitter grassy notes w/ subtle honey and apple flavor w/ slight alcohol influence on the palate . the beer has mild tart apple skin taste that continues into the drying finish d - a pretty tasty biere de garde , but it seems like an americanized take on the style with generous hops and inensity of alcohol , it is n't as true to style as it could be but was certainly interesting enough to hold my interest - thanks tb69 for sharing !  mouthfeel is quite nice .

aroma of very spicy hops , some meaty malts ... an all around exciting aroma . unfortunately the taste does n't back it up .  the mouthfeel is wonderful . the carbonation seems a bit higher than other imp stouts , but it goes well with the very thick , almost syrupy texture of the beer .

pours a slightly hazed golden orange color , with a tremendous , bright white head that stays put , huge clumps of sticky lacing ... just phenomenal looking in the glass .  lower carbonation levels and rich body lend to the extra smooth feel .

the beers pours a jet black color with a think , persistent , creamy head .  the taste and feel to me are perfect . not super thick , but still able to coat and linger . a well balanced flavor not too sweet or bitter , and carbonation that lasts to the bottom .

lots of spicy hopy with a huge caramel sweetness overtone . some grains in the background that help this brew maintain a very bold nose . some burnt grains and a hint of citrus , with a burnt bitter finish .  very very thick and chewy . almost a meal by itself .

an aroma of malt , dark fruit and spices .  mouthfeel is pure silk . very creamy .
